ygData.subject: New HyperSharpNEAT-based Multiagent Simulator

Subject: New HyperSharpNEAT-based Multiagent Simulator
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=54567749; y=xOqHvQfP6nMnWuIqW7zCXkbjaCoWe5qqkzd2JQU4AZI64ppegBJH
X-Yahoo-Profile: kenstanley01

David D'Ambrosio, Joel Lehman, and Sebastian Risi, and I are pleased to ann=
ounce a new multiagent simulator (including source code) built on HyperShar=
pNEAT and featuring multiagent HyperNEAT:  

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/softwa=
re.html#multiagentSim

The package includes a GUI, both CPPN and multiagent=
 substrate visualization tools, and sample genomes and experiments from the=
 room-clearing domain.  Simulated agents are robots with rangefinder sensor=
s.  The GUI allows operations such as picking up a robot and moving it in t=
he middle of testing, or placing a new wall.  

Our hope is that this packa=
ge makes multiagent HyperNEAT, which is described most recently in the foll=
owing paper, more accessible to those interested:

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/=
papers/dambrosio_aamas10.pdf

It should also be possible to test other meth=
ods in the same simulator.  The lightweight design of the simulator is well=
-suited to evolutionary and learning experiments in which many training tri=
als must be run faster than real-time.

ken
